intro: Cnidium cuneifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved cnidium, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, often aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in woodland and shrubland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. The roots of Cnidium cuneifolium have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
